definition: to make a living doing manual labor/to give sth all one's got
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: He worked hard, though still poor in health.
sentences.chinese: 他固然身體不好，可是任務起來很賣力氣。

sentences.english: The manager threatened his men with dismissal in order to bully them into working harder.
sentences.chinese: 經理以解僱來威脅職工，迫使他們更賣力氣。

sentences.english: No mater where he works, he is always working hard.
sentences.chinese: 無論他在哪兒幹活，他總是很賣力氣。

sentences.english: China's aggressiveness makes them a difficult team to beat.
sentences.chinese: 中國隊非常的賣力氣，這使他們很難戰勝。

sentences.english: Not brilliant, Robyn, but I'll give you ten out of ten for effort.
sentences.chinese: 做得不算頂好，羅賓，但要論賣力氣我給你打滿分。

sentences.english: Bob is working very hard and he even offered to work overtime.
sentences.chinese: 鮑勃工作很賣力氣，他還主動加班工作。
